products.title: Paper Shopping Bag with Twisted Handles
products.body_html: Packs of 250ct

products.title: 2025 U.S. Cup Tasters Championship
products.body_html:
Welcome to the 2025 U.S. Cup Tasters Championship happening at 2nd Street Studios, by Onyx Coffee Lab! Get ready for a day filled with coffee, competition, and fun. Join us Thu May 08 - Sat May 10 to witness some of the best coffee tasters in the country showcase their skills. Whether you're a coffee enthusiast or just looking for a good time, this event is perfect for you. Don't miss out on the opportunity to taste some amazing coffee and see who will be crowned the champion. See you there!

May 8-10
7AM - 5PM CST

2nd Street Studios
219 North 2nd Street Rogers, AR 72756

products.title: Honduras Benjamin Paz Gesha
products.body_html: Benjamin Paz is a visionary producer, roaster, and exporter who has shaped the specialty coffee landscape of Santa Barbara, Honduras. His farm, La Salsa, perched high in the mountains, produces award-winning Gesha, a reflection of both its Panamanian heritage and the distinct volcanic terroir of the region.

products.title: Costa Rica Cascara
products.body_html: THIS IS NOT COFFEE... well not in the traditional sense. Cascara is the dried fruit husk & skins of coffee cherries. These are meticulously selected, cleaned and dried carefully to keep the structure intact. Use for brewing into a tea, simple syrup, or create a floral flavor in cooking. Extracts very easily and notes of Vanilla, Oak and cherry come to the forefront.

products.title: Panama Elida Estate Gesha Anaerobic
products.body_html: Elida Estate in Boquete, Panama has become synonymous with industry-leading quality when it comes to coffee. Winning the best of Panama and the choice of many world champions, their Gesha has literally changed the way coffee is now traded. Enjoy legendary work from true master farming, perfectly encapsulating what we expect from a washed Gesha grown in Panama.

products.title: New Belgium
products.body_html: Every year, New Belgium’s award-winning wood-aged sour program releases it’s annual La Folie Reserve, a pioneering, coffee-infused sour ale that has earned a reputation for its bold experimentation. This year, their release features a beer infused with this offering from our friends at Las Lajas. Working with New Belgium has allowed us to explore how our coffee can be experienced in a new way, and it’s an honor to highlight our friends at Las Lajas through this collaboration. Enjoy notes of peach, mixed berry, raw sugar, and dark chocolate.

products.title: Onyx Coffee Academy: Latte Art Foundation
products.body_html:
Led by the Onyx Coffee Lab Education Team, this 2 hour course will equip the beginner or curious with an understanding of theory and practical skills to pour better latte art at home. A hands on drink making class covering the basics of latte art, in depth exploration and practicing pouring different styles of art. Class is set up for beginner to intermediate home baristas who are looking for hands on tips and tricks to steam more consistent milk and pour better latte art.

Classes will take place in person at 2nd St. Studios in Rogers, Arkansas.

products.title: Onyx Coffee Academy: Pour Over Basics
products.body_html:
The Onyx Education Team will teach you to make pour-over coffee with the Origami Air S Dripper. This two-and-a-half-hour course will equip the enthusiast or curious to understand the theory and practical skills to prepare better coffee. With a focus on "pour-overs," we will explore the essentials of hand brewing and the variables that will impact the consistency and quality of coffee. Additionally, after the class, receive a code for 15% off the first order of your new Onyx subscription.

Classes will take place in person at 2nd St. Studios in Rogers, Arkansas.

products.title: Colombia Jairo Arcila Pink Bourbon
products.body_html: Jairo Arcila, a third-generation coffee grower from Quindío, Colombia, has built a legacy of excellence by blending tradition, innovation, and community impact. With the guidance of his sons, Jairo has embraced advanced processing techniques and cultivated exotic varieties like Pink Bourbon and Gesha across his six farms, creating coffees like this Pink Bourbon. With his collaborative approach, Jairo has excelled at creating coffees that simultaneously represent the tradition of coffee cultivation while also illuminating the path forward.

products.title: Ecuador La Papaya Typica
products.body_html: In just a few years, Juan Peña has become a leading figure in the coffee industry, known for his scientific approach to cultivation and processing at Hacienda La Papaya in Ecuador. Originally transitioning from roses to coffee, his meticulous methods and dedication have produced award-winning coffees with exceptional clarity and complexity. Through CafExporto, Juan has achieved the control he envisioned, offering direct access to his meticulously crafted coffees.

products.title: Peru Davila Ruiz Salvador
products.body_html: In Northern Peru’s Alto Mayo protected forest, the Beirut community cultivates exceptional coffee at 800–3,400 masl. With crisp nights, temperate days, and rich soil nourished by Bokashi-style fertilizer, farmers grow Typica, Caturra, and Catimor. Salvador Dávila Ruiz’s Agua Dulce farm, nearly 30 years old, exemplifies sustainability with innovative water treatment. While more accessible than Southern Peru, Beirut’s coffee depends on specialty market access to thrive in harmony with its environment.

products.title: Colombia La Riviera SL28
products.body_html: La Riviera's coffees, cultivated at 1,750 meters in Santa Rosa de Cabal, Risaralda, reflect a deep commitment to ecological farming and innovative processing. Producers Julio Madrid and Julio Quiceno, who have been refining their craft since 2013, employ cutting-edge fermentation techniques to elevate the coffee's complexity and balance. Their sustainable practices and bold experimentation drives the future of specialty coffee.

products.title: Doyenne
products.body_html:
Doyenne is defined as a woman who is the most prominent person in a particular field. Coffee production is traditionally male led due to the cultural relationship dynamics in producing countries. Women have always contributed to and are often the backbone of coffee production, contributing detail oriented, quality-focused excellence to the field. Until recent years, they are rarely honored for this work. Doyenne seeks to identify and amplify the stories of woman achieving incredible marks in coffee. The selections are curated by Andrea Allen, co-founder of Onyx Coffee Lab and 2020 US Barista Champion. The heart is for women to collaborate and to boost each others work and achievement through stories. 

Subscribe to experience great coffees and hear the stories behind them. Be part of changing the paradigm in Specialty Coffee.

products.title: Colombia Eliana Mensa Pink Bourbon
products.body_html: Discovered through one of our closest collaborators, Fernando Oka, this exceptional coffee is the creation of Eliana María Mensa, a producer whose dedication to quality is unparalleled. Cultivated in the high altitudes of San Antonio, Colombia, at 2,100 meters above sea level, the coffee thrives under challenging yet rewarding conditions. After meticulous selection at peak ripeness, the coffee underwent a three-day carbonic maceration in anaerobic tanks, yielding a cup with classic elegance, unique complexity, and vibrant character.

products.title: Ecuador Hacienda La Papaya Oak Barrel
products.body_html: This Typica variety from Juan Peña undergoes a distinctive limited-oxygen fermentation process in Ecuadorian rum barrels. The outcome is a coffee rich in natural sugars and fruit esters derived from the long fermentation of coffee cherries. In the cup, these characteristics manifest as raw wine and ripe berries, making this offering particularly appealing to lovers of fruit-forward coffees.

products.title: Colombia Edward Sandoval Chiroso
products.body_html: This is another washed micro-lot from our friends at Pergamino coffee. Edward Sandoval produces coffee in Ibague, Tolima, which yields an altogether unique cup profile. Highlighting the unique terroir of Tolima, expect delicate melon and a tea-like tactile in this versatile coffee. We enjoy this coffee thoroughly as a filter offering.

products.title: Lavender Chamomile Rooibos
products.body_html: This herbal blend features artisan-grown American Lavender flowers and Egyptian Chamomile flowers blended with Rooibos grown in the Cape Floristic Region of South Africa, a world heritage site recognized for its special plant diversity and density. The cup is floral, sweet and comforting. It is naturally caffeine free.

products.title: Nitrile Black Gloves
products.body_html:
Nitrile Powder-FREE Glove
- M, L, XL
- 1000 Ct.
- Black

products.title: Colombia Aponte Village Honey
products.body_html: A stalwart offering year after year, this macro-lot from the Aponte Village in Narino is intensely sweet in the cup, balanced by a tart, citric acidity. Processed in a unique way, this red-honey is partially dried before it is depulped, giving it a layered, fruited complexity and heavy tactile.

products.title: Onyx Coffee Academy: Onyx Drink Making
products.body_html:
Led by the Onyx Coffee Lab Education team and the head of menu development, this 2.5 hour course will prepare you to make the best tasting drinks at home from start to finish. 

From learning about flavor combinations and choosing complementary pairings to how to prepare 3 different Onyx menu beverages. In addition you will have the opportunity to come up with your own favorite flavor combos and take home recipe cards of the drinks you created, ready to make them for your friends and family during your next gathering.

Classes will take place in person at 2nd St. Studios in Rogers, Arkansas.

products.title: Onyx Coffee Academy: Intro to Espresso Drinks
products.body_html:
Led by the Onyx Coffee Lab Education Team, this 2.5-hour course will equip the enthusiast or curious with an understanding of theory and practical skills to prepare better coffee at home. With a focus on "espresso-based drinks," we will explore barista skills of shot pulling and milk steaming with an introduction to latte art. Class will be held using home espresso machines and grinders, to give home baristas a better understanding on how their machines work, how to dial in, and steam milk properly.

Classes will take place in person at 2nd St. Studios in Rogers, Arkansas.

products.title: Onyx Coffee Academy: Pour Over Basics
products.body_html:
The Onyx Education Team will teach you to make pour-over coffee with the Origami Air S Dripper. This two-and-a-half-hour course will equip the enthusiast or curious to understand the theory and practical skills to prepare better coffee. With a focus on "pour-overs," we will explore the essentials of hand brewing and the variables that will impact the consistency and quality of coffee. Additionally, after the class, receive a code for 15% off the first order of your new Onyx subscription.

Classes will take place in person at 2nd St. Studios in Rogers, Arkansas.

products.title: Onyx Coffee Academy: Coffee 101
products.body_html:
Led by the Onyx Coffee Lab Education Team, this 1.5-hour course will equip the curious with a better rounded understanding of coffee theory, where coffee comes from, different processing methods, and how to use that knowledge to better find coffees that match their preferences. We will also be doing a coffee cupping, tasting through several different coffees from our catalog and learning how and why coffee professionals cup coffee in an engaging class-like setting. After the class, receive a code for 15% off the first order of your new Onyx subscription.

Classes will take place in person at 2nd St. Studios in Rogers, Arkansas.

products.title: Peru Isaias Ruiz Vasquez
products.body_html: In the Alto Mayo protected forest of Northern Peru, the community of Beirut produces exceptional coffee amidst native cedar and Ishpingo trees. Isaias Ruiz, a second-generation producer, cultivates traditional Typica on his farm, Los Frutales, while using sustainable practices like Bokashi fertilization. Through dedication and meticulous post-harvest care, his coffee showcases the vibrant potential of Alto Mayo.

products.title: Krampus
products.body_html: As sounds of concern rend the air in our roastery each holiday season, we know Krampus has made his annual appearance. Krampus set out to burn our most prized peaberries to scare us into being good, but the joke is on him, because we’re already on our best behavior, and what he scorched and left behind is actually delicious. This peaberry selection hails from the Rungeto Factory in Kenya’s Kii cooperative. Sourced from peak outturns, it allows us to offer this seasonal single-origin, rich with deep chocolate and burned citrus notes.

products.title: Peppermint Yerba Mate
products.body_html: This crisp, light botanical tea is a blend designed to soothe and energize at the same time. Green leaves from the yerba mate plant, an evergreen tree in the holly family, are dried over a fire and then blended with organic peppermint leaves to produce a refreshing sweetness that coats the tongue with each calming sip. Yerba mate naturally contains caffeine.

products.title: MK Ceramics Set - Onyx Edition
products.body_html:
Introducing the new custom Onyx x MK Ceramics Brewing Set. Customized MK Drippers are back, and this time, they brought friends. These premium handcrafted ceramics from Copenhagen have arrived to revitalize your brewing setup. Set includes customized flat-bottom MK Dripper, a 500ml Carafe, an 8.5oz Sense Cup, and Plate. Pairing MK's innovative designs with customized Onyx branding leads to a truly spectacular coffee set.

-High quality ceramic material
-Each piece is unique
-Handcrafted in Denmark
-Dishwasher safe

products.title: MK Sense Cup - Onyx Edition
products.body_html:
Meet the conversation piece of your coffee set. Designed with the daily drinking and sensory experience in mind, the stunning modern silhouette of these cups is matched by the weighty feel of premium materials. Meticulously handmade in Copenhagen, each one is entirely unique. With a volume of up to 8.5oz, these cups are ideal for small to medium brews and slow sips. Enjoy!

-250ml / 8.5oz
-Premium porcelain
-Each piece is unique
-Handcrafted in Denmark
-Dishwasher safe

products.title: MK Dripper & Plate - Onyx Edition
products.body_html:
Achieve the ultimate flavor experience with the MK Dripper. This dripper is handmade by the celebrated Magdalena and Michal in Copenhagen. Its form is based on the trapezoidal, or flat bottom, brewer called the Kalita Wave 185. However, it has been modernized with the help of world class brewers like 2x World Brewers Cup Finalist, Elika Liftee.

This ceramic dripper features a flat and wide brew column to achieve a balance of sweetness, body, and acidity from your coffee. The addition of a raised bubble in the bottom, combined with 5 large drain holes give you the balanced cup of a flat bottom dripper, with the fast flow and clarity of a cone dripper. Elika used this dripper to secure his second US Brewers Cup Championship and a runner-up placement at the World Brewers Cup in 2022.

Recommended filter: Sibarist Paper Filters
Weight: 330g
Dishwasher safe
1-3 Cups recommended

products.title: MK Carafe - Onyx Edition
products.body_html:
The perfect partner for your new MK Dripper, this 500ml carafe is ideal for small to medium sized coffee sessions. Intricate handmade detailing takes an ordinary server and turns it into a work of art. With a flared spout for precision pouring and premium materials for high-performance insulation, this is an essential piece to a truly spectacular coffee set.

500ml / 16.9oz
Each piece is unique
Handcrafted in Denmark
Dishwasher safe
